Expectation1: Be friendly and polite in daily interactions
Situation1: Having just moved in, they prepare a small cake to share with nearby neighbors when they happen to meet.
Expectation2: Follow traffic laws and drive defensively
Situation2: Steady rain and frequent lane changes from nearby cars raise the risk of sudden stops
Story: I had just moved into the apartment complex last week, and today, I finally baked a small cake to share with my new neighbors. I wrapped it carefully, hoping to make a good impression. As I stepped out, I saw Mrs. Kim from next door heading to her car. I smiled, cake in hand, ready to introduce myself and offer a slice. But my phone buzzed—my taxi app had matched me with a passenger, and I was already running late. The rain was coming down hard, and I knew the roads would be slick, with impatient drivers weaving between lanes. As a taxi driver, I was expected to be on time, drive safely, and follow every traffic rule, especially in weather like this. But as a neighbor, I wanted to be warm and welcoming, to show I cared about the community I was joining. I stood there, cake in one hand, car keys in the other, heart pounding as I weighed the expectations pressing in from both sides.
